Author: allbits#5898
Content: We were sure you abandoned it. That wasn't FUD was it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
NXT broke backward compatibility in 2014 and I was not happy about it and complained. they promised not to do it again. Of course they did it again in 2015 and then to justify breaking one of the few running services, they used the fact that they posted the breaking changes in some obscure dev channel. And then used the fact that since they posted it someone might be using it so they couldnt change it as it would break backward compatibility!

So they prioritized some theoretical possibility of violating backward compatibility for some mythical project that couldnt have been completed yet (if it even existed) over the running MGW service.

clearly they were mocking me. I had 100% of my tech built on NXT and NXT was betraying me... I said that they needed to honor their commitment for backward compatibility or I would be forced to leave NXT.

For this I am enemy #1 inside of NXT and outside of NXT I am some sort of NXT insider doing evil things

Author: allbits#5898
Content: That was my perception of what happened too.  I followed all that drama closely. Looking back though, it's so great that that happened. It forced you into a fundamental redesign of how to achieve your crypto ambitions. The iterations of that redesign have turned out to be the leading blockchain infrastructure ... by far. And your dedication and daily perseverance, over many years, has attracted and inspired a deep and talented development team.  I figure that anyone who can't see all that is just doing a drive-by "analysis", which is all too common in crypto and the world at large.

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: @jl777c Is it possible to apply dPOW on the CryptoNight POW Algo?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, it is possible, dPoW makes no assumptions about the underlying consensus mechansm

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however, i dont think any cryptonight has implemented dPoW yet

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content:
Wow, great, would it be the same integration as what Hush did? Yes, it would be nice if dPoW would be integrated on CryptoNight based PoW.
How about CC, since CC is like a paper on how to create UTXO based Smart Contracts, do you think it is just solely for BTC based forks, or it can be applied on for example Bytecoin and others?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in principle it would work with any utxo based coin

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: Okay, so KMD chain is already handling dPoW. SuperNet is just the market

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: SuperNET codebase has the notarizer that notaries run, but the validation of dPoW is necessarily in the KMD code

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also a lot of code is shared between the notarizer and the mm1

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: okay, so for Asset Chain, I see that in chainparams it is a dynamic creation of some block specific data, so am I correct if the genesis Hash should be the current Komodo Hash at the time the asset chain is created?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: actually there isnt a practicalway to do runtime forks without sharing genesis block. the first mined block is really the assetchains genesis block

Content: They share genesis block but cannot sync from each other.

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: Some noob question again, so how does sending KMDs hash to Bitcoin able to share BTCs hashrate

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: So is it like when a 51% attack happens on Komodo, they must compute for the hash from BTC(Which came from KMD NN) then compute again for the hash that in KMD(Original KMD hash)?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @josephnicholas GMT+8 KMD sends blockhashes to BTC inside OP_RETURN data. Then all KMD nodes have consensus rules that prevent the re-organization of those blocks, hence, you would need to perform a 51% attack on BTC to accomplish the same on KMD.

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: So the dPOW implementation is not merely pointed on `KMD sends hashes to BTC` but because  of the consensus rules?

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: nodes = NN right?
